Articles.Content:
I've always played vanilla, but I wanted to add Tweakscale, so I did.

Downloaded the mod, unzipped it, and dropped it into my "GameData" directory. Then I opened KSP, made a new sandbox game, went to the VAB, added a part, right-clicked, and...nothing.

I feel stupid. What step am I missing?

@sevenperforce when you unzip it, open up the new folder (the new folder should be called GameData) and then take the folder named TweakScale and put that into your KSP/GameData folder (the file path should be KSPlocation/KSPfolder/GameData/TweakScale not KSPlocation/KSPfolder/GameData/GameData/TweakScale)

5 minutes ago, TheRagingIrishman said:

@sevenperforce when you unzip it, open up the new folder (the new folder should be called GameData) and then take the folder named TweakScale and put that into your KSP/GameData folder (the file path should be KSPlocation/KSPfolder/GameData/TweakScale not KSPlocation/KSPfolder/GameData/GameData/TweakScale)

That's what I did.

EDIT: Ah, I see the problem. i needed to drop the ModuleManager dll into the GameData folder too.

Edited May 24, 2017 by sevenperforce
oh ya I should have mentioned that as well. ModuleManager is required for any mod that does anything to parts (it lets mods modify other mods/stock parts)
